p: H6 AIVs affect both domestic poultry and wild birds. H6Nx infections have caused sustained poultry infections (ducks and chickens) and circulate in live bird markets (LBMs) in China. Surveillance indicates that H6 viruses have become enzootic in domestic ducks of southern China, mostly as H6N6 viruses. An 8-year surveillance study (1998â€“2006), that included more than 36,000 wild birds from Europe and the Americas, found that H6 was the most abundantly detected influenza virus subtype [ 18]. H6Nx viruses now boast the broadest host range compared to any other subtype [ 18].
